hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via ETH/BTC Ratio Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when ETH/BTC ratio forms a higher low above its 100-day moving average, then breaks above its 20-day resistance on volume >2x average, this signals impending BULL regime transition as capital rotates from store-of-value to smart contract platforms.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETH/BTC ratio strength indicates risk-on sentiment returning to crypto. During regulatory clarity periods (MiCA implementation), ETH often leads due to its institutional product ecosystem. Volume confirmation reduces false breakouts.
entry_conditions: Ratio forms higher low (last 5 days) > prior low (5-10 days ago)
Ratio breaks 20-day high with >2x 30-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC regime transitions to BULL (hypothesis confirmed, capture remaining momentum)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio falls below its 100-day MA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 14 days without regime transition to BULL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals see ratio revert below breakout level within 5 days while BTC remains in NEUTRAL regime for 15+ additional days.
